item.title: Ansible dynamic inventory with AWS EC2
item.description: By using ansible dynamic inventory, we can run ansible based on instances’ tags, such as app=backend,env=staging etc. Here will talk about how to make use of defined tags on AWS EC2 and run ansible-playbook scripts onto them. 1. Define a few tags on target EC2 instances Define some tags on created EC2, such as App=backend, Environment=staging, Usage=clock-worker To assign tags on the multiple instances, you can use with AWS Resource Tag editor.
